item.title: Church leader tortured and raped disciples, BBC finds
item.description: Forced abortions and other atrocities are alleged by dozens of ex-followers of a charismatic televangelist.

item.title: Sunak considers ways to clear all victims of Post Office scandal
item.description: The justice secretary is looking into steps to help hundreds of wrongly convicted sub-postmasters.

item.title: London Tube strikes called off as more pay talks planned
item.description: Little or no service was expected on London Underground until Friday morning.

item.title: Boeing 737 Max 9: Jets to stay grounded as inspections continue
item.description: The US aviation regulator says 171 Boeing planes will remain grounded until it is satisfied they are safe.

item.title: Pioneering transplant surgeon Sir Roy Calne dies aged 93
item.description: Sir Roy Calne's son, Russell, says his dad was a "genius" who will be missed by those who knew him.

item.title: Margot Robbie, Barry Keoghan and more on Golden Globes red carpet
item.description: Hollywood stars are arriving at the ceremony in Los Angeles in a variety of eye-catching outfits.

item.title: Arsenal 0-2 Liverpool: Jakub Kiwior own goal and Luis Diaz strike in FA Cup win for Reds
item.description: Jakub Kiwior's own goal and a clinical Luis Diaz strike give Liverpool a 2-0 victory at Arsenal in the FA Cup third round.

item.title: Mouse filmed tidying up man's shed every night
item.description: Retired postman Rodney Holbrook never expected to capture a Ratatouille-style scene in his own shed.

item.title: Tories pick Peter Bone's partner to fight his old seat
item.description: North Northamptonshire councillor Helen Harrison becomes Tory candidate in Wellingborough by-election.

item.title: Al Jazeera bureau chief's son Hamza al-Dahdouh among journalists killed in Gaza
item.description: Hamza al-Dahdouh was with other journalists when a reported strike hit a road between Khan Younis and Rafah.

item.title: Lincolnshire: Two die after car enters canal at Tetney Lock
item.description: A 16-year-old boy and man, 40, became submerged in water in their car in Lincolnshire, police say.

item.title: Actress dashes 150 miles to save illness-hit Evita musical
item.description: Jessica Daley travelled from Middlesbrough to Leicester to star as Eva Peron in Evita on Saturday.

item.title: TB Joshua: ‘We thought it was heaven but then terrible things happened’
item.description: Rae was 21 when she became a charismatic Nigerian preacher’s disciple - and suffered years of abuse.

item.title: The Papers: 'Not over yet' for flood risks and 'top Tory says party faces obliteration'
item.description: Stark images of England's ongoing flood misery make the front pages as does fresh speculation about the Conservatives' election chances.

item.title: Prince Andrew's return less likely than ever after nightmare new year
item.description: The problems for Prince Andrew from his association with disgraced US financier Jeffrey Epstein show no signs of going away.

item.title: The last of the Moon men: the stories of the surviving Apollo astronauts
item.description: Who are the eight surviving members of humanity's greatest feat of exploration?

item.title: Rafael Nadal: Why Spanish great will be so missed at Australian Open
item.description: As Rafael Nadal withdraws from this year's Australian Open - and potentially says goodbye to the tournament for good - BBC Sport looks at his most memorable Melbourne moments.

item.title: Earning the trust of a 40-stone silverback gorilla
item.description: A wildlife cameraman's close encounter with a silverback as he filmed a process designed to save the species.

item.title: Kids inspired by Luke Littler aiming high (and low) to achieve darts dream
item.description: Coaches and young players give their top tips on how aspiring darts stars should get started.

item.title: Israel-Palestinian bitterness deepened by Hamas attack and war
item.description: Both Israelis and Palestinians believe the world does not understand their pain and suffering.

item.title: General Tso’s chicken to bento bowls: A food guide to Taiwan politics
item.description: Unique flavour combinations and profiles represent how Taiwan's unique identity is starting to take shape.

item.title: How much National Insurance will I pay after today's cut?
item.description: National Insurance rates are falling, but other changes mean many people are paying more tax.

item.title: Hundreds take part in ancient hood village showdown
item.description: The annual Haxey Hood rugby-style contest took place in two North Lincolnshire villages.

item.title: Kenya's push to make 'boda-boda' motorbike taxis go electric
item.description: The government wants Kenya's three million motorbike taxi riders to go green but only a few have done so.

item.title: Starmer worries about toll of election on his children
item.description: The Labour leader calls for a general election as soon as possible, adding that he wanted the fight.

item.title: Lloyd Austin: White House not told for days defence secretary in hospital
item.description: White House officials tell US media that Lloyd Austin's treatment was kept quiet for three days.

item.title: Watchdog to assess claims against pensions minister Paul Maynard
item.description: Paul Maynard is accused of using taxpayer money to fund Conservative Party work and campaigning.

item.title: 20mph speed limit enforcement to start in Wales this month
item.description: The new speed limit is set to be enforced after a three-and-a-half month "bedding in period".

item.title: Post Office: Sub-postmistress 'lost everything' in Horizon scandal
item.description: Tracy McFadden was wrongly accused of stealing £16,000 by the Post Office.

item.title: Rafael Nadal: Spaniard to miss Australian Open following hip injury
item.description: Rafael Nadal says he will miss the Australian Open after sustaining a hip injury at the Brisbane International this week.

item.title: Kevin de Bruyne: Man City boss Pep Guardiola says 'the people love him' as midfielder returns
item.description: Manchester City made a routine start to their FA Cup defence against Huddersfield, but it was the sight of a returning Kevin de Bruyne that proved the real highlight for the home fans.

item.title: FA Cup 2024: Liverpool beat Arsenal - goals and highlights
item.description: Watch highlights as Liverpool progress to the fourth round of the FA Cup as two late goals secure Jurgen Klopp's side a 2-0 victory at Arsenal.

item.title: FA Cup 2024: Leeds' Patrick Bamford scores a belter against Peterborough - all the angles
item.description: Watch all the angles as Patrick Bamford scores a "belter" of a volley to double Leeds' advantage over Peterborough United in the FA Cup third round.

item.title: FA Cup third-round replays affect Premier League winter break for seven teams
item.description: Jurgen Klopp celebrates the "biggest bonus" after avoiding an FA Cup replay but seven managers face losing some of their winter break.

item.title: Six Nations 2024: Immanuel Feyi-Waboso set to opt for England over Wales before tournament
item.description: Exeter's in-form winger Immanuel Feyi-Waboso looks set to choose England over Wales before the 2024 Six Nations.
